page.title: 12MIXED FARMING NEAR EARDISLEY
page.content: The average mixed farm in this area is of about 50-100 acres.Farmers usually grow grass for silage or hay. This is stored in silage clamps or barns to feed to the stock in winter. Many farmers have sheep.These lamb from January to May.Nearly all farmers have trouble with foxes.All farmers have dogs.The most common breeds of sheep are Suffolk and Clun.Cattle farmers usually have Hereford cross animals.They fatten them and sell them at Hereford market.Sometimes the animals get diseases like Popeye and Bloat.Then the vet has to come.The nearest vets are in Kington,Weobley or Leominster.In summer the farms smell of hay.The farmers have to work fast to beat the weather.They help each other and share equipment.If they grow corn they usually have problems with crows.
